content: all about the puff puff slouchy with a shaped camel-stitch band a youtube tutorial for this pattern is available on my channel wheelie made it crochet https //youtu be/ 3h20yhof0ta if you come across any errors in this pattern please let me know this is the first written pattern i ve shared publicly and i d love to know how you go with it - tag me if you share photos of your beanie on instagram so i can admire photo a - button placement wheelie made it crochet puff slouchy page 1 supplies yarn australian 8 ply/dk yarn this pattern works well with a basic solid colour yarn and also looks good made with some variegated yarns yardage 230 metres / 251 yards hook 4mm needle for sewing in tails scissors 2 x stitch markers optional a pretty button optional gauge after round 4 stop and measure the diameter of your circle to match gauge it needs to measure 10cm/4 inches at this size the beanie will fit most women it s a forgiving style and looks good both a little large and loose on smaller heads and when it s a good fit on an average/medium sized woman s head about this pattern this pattern is worked from the top down in a continuous round there is occasionally a gap at the beginning of round 2 where you begin working in a continuous round you can use the tail from the magic_ring to close this gap sew the magic_ring closed first then use the tail to pull the bottom of the first stitch in round 2 down a little the stitch count for each round is the number in brackets at the end of the line this beanie has a shaped band if you do not want a shaped band leave out the decreases in the first 2 rounds of the band wheelie made it crochet puff slouchy page 2 the slouchy is very loose before you add the band if you feel it is still too loose when you finish the band you can work an extra round to make the band tighter being camel stitch it gets tighter with each round ideally the band should be a little too firm initially because when you wear the beanie it will stretch but if it is too tight first try stretching it with your hands if that doesn t make it loose enough try unravel a round i always sew a button on because it s cute and practical to position it you can either wear the beanie and pick where you think it looks good or fold the beanie in half and sew the button about 3cm from the fold as shown in photo a i also think it helps to sew a label inside the beanie to the band at the point you finish off the button and the label help to quickly get the beanie on properly - label at the back of the head
